item.title: Who could challenge Harris for Democratic nomination?
item.description: Mr Biden has endorsed his VP to replace him - but it is not a done deal, and other names are in the hat.

item.title: Many Democrats Back Kamala Harris In 2024 But Nancy Pelosi, Others Silent
item.description: Many Democrats on Sunday quickly backed Vice President Kamala Harris to run as the party's presidential nominee against Donald Trump after incumbent President Joe Biden's abrupt departure from the race, but some powerful party members, including form

item.title: "Will Do Everything In My Power...": Kamala Harris Vows To Defeat Trump
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris praised President Joe Biden's "patriotic" decision not to seek reelection Sunday and vowed to win the Democratic nomination and defeat Donald Trump.

item.title: From Kamala Harris To Josh Shapiro: Who Will Replace Biden In 2024 Race?
item.description: Joe Biden's withdrawal from the race for the White House leaves a gap atop the Democratic presidential ticket that the party is now rushing to fill.

item.title: List Of 36 Democrats In US Congress Who Publicly Called On Biden To Quit
item.description: Thirty-six congressional Democrats have publicly called on Democratic President Joe Biden to end his re-election bid after the 81-year-old incumbent's halting debate performance against Republican rival Donald Trump.

item.title: How Foreign Leaders Reacted To Biden Dropping Out Of White House Race
item.description: Following are some reactions from abroad to U.S. President Joe Biden's decision on Sunday to pull out of his campaign to seek reelection in November:

item.title: Clintons Praise Biden's "Extraordinary Career Of Service", Endorse Harris
item.description: Former president Bill Clinton and ex-secretary of state Hillary Clinton praised Joe Biden's decision to abandon his White House reelection bid Sunday, and threw their support behind Vice President Kamala Harris to take up the baton.

item.title: "Crooked Biden Was Not Fit To Run For President": Donald Trump
item.description: Former president Donald Trump on Sunday reacted to Joe Biden ending his reelection bid, claiming the incumbent president is "certainly not fit to serve."

item.title: Joe Biden: Stubborn President Who Fought A Battle Too Far
item.description: Joe Biden wanted to save the "soul of America" from Donald Trump, but his stubborn defiance of the march of time may have cleared his rival's path back to power.

item.title: Monday Briefing: Biden Ends His Re-Election Bid
item.description: The president endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris to continue the race against Donald Trump.

item.title: Biden Is Out. What Happens to His Money? - The New York Times
item.description:
1. Biden Is Out. What Happens to His Money?  The New York Times
  2. What could happen to Biden campaign’s $91 million?  Fox News
  3. What happens to Biden’s campaign funds?  The Hill
  4. After Biden drops out and endorses Harris, what to know about campaign funds, primaries  USA TODAY
  5. Now that Biden dropped out, what happens to his campaign funds?  Yahoo! Voices

item.title: Joe Biden hailed as 'great president' after ending US presidency reelection bid
Kamala Harris says she will 'earn and win' Democratic nomination for US President and beat Donald Trump
item.description: Kamala Harris praised Biden's 2024 exit as 'selfless'. Endorsed, she aims to defeat Trump. Born in Oakland, Howard alumna and SF DA, Harris advocates for reproductive rights. She faced a brief 2020 bid and Obama endorsed her 2010 race. Could be first Black woman nominee. She faces Newsom, Whitmer, Shapiro. Chicago Democratic convention is her first test.

item.title: World leaders react to Biden’s decision to exit presidential race
item.description:
Polish prime minister Donald Tusk among US allies to pay tribute to US president’s decades of public service

  • Biden drops out of presidential race – live updates
  • Biden drops out: what to know about his decision, Kamala Harris and the Republican response

Leaders from around the world have begun to react to Joe Biden’s announcement that he would not seek re-election this year, endorsing vice-president Kamala Harris in the most unorthodox US presidential campaign in generations.

US allies largely offered tributes to Biden’s work over decades of government service, discussing his work as a partner in international security, without addressing the tense political debate still unfolding in the US.

Continue reading...

item.title: Starmer praises Biden’s ‘remarkable’ career after US election withdrawal
item.description:
Prime minister among UK political leaders to celebrate US president’s achievements and character

  • Joe Biden withdraws from 2024 presidential race – live
  • The tragedy and resilience of Joe Biden: a look back at a life in politics

Sir Keir Starmer says he respects Joe Biden’s decision to pull out of the US presidential election, describing the 81-year-old’s political career as “remarkable”.

The UK prime minister said: “I respect President Biden’s decision and I look forward to us working together during the remainder of his presidency.

Continue reading...

item.title: Biden’s selfless decision to drop out sets stage for an entirely different election
item.description:
The president will be remembered for steering the US to recovery and giving his party a chance to beat Trump again

Legend has it that when King George III heard that George Washington, the first US president, had decided to retire after his second term, he remarked: “If he does that, he will be the greatest man in the world.”

Joe Biden, 81, holed up at a Delaware beach house with a bad cough after a Covid-19 diagnosis, ended his presidential re-election campaign on Sunday. It was a selfless decision that put the country’s interests before his own – an act of grace that many see as vividly contrasting with the narcissism of his opponent Donald Trump.

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump leads Republican taunts of Biden after president drops out of 2024 race
item.description:
Former president and other Republicans say Biden is ‘not fit to serve’, with some saying he should resign immediately

  • Biden drops out of presidential race – live updates

Donald Trump’s vicious attack on Joe Biden and his legacy led the Republican party’s reaction to the president’s decision to withdraw from the 2024 race.

“Crooked Joe Biden was not fit to run for president, and is certainly not fit to serve – and never was!” Trump, the Republican nominee, said in a post to Truth Social, repeating his favored insult for the man who beat him in the 2020 election, and rehashing a familiar litany of unsubstantiated grievances.

Continue reading...

item.title: Johnson warns of legal challenges if Dems swap nominees
Outside the RNC, small Milwaukee businesses and their regulars tried to salvage a sluggish week
Johnson: Replacing Biden on ticket would be 'wrong,' 'unlawful'
